TopicTitle: Laythecat is bestcat. (Chobit's house of madness) The one thread to rule them all!

Articles.Content:
*facepalm*

Chobit, we talked about this...

Aye, but Shultz had the disadvantage of only having one laser and was attacking an unknown target. If he had known the Yamato's capabilities he'd have sortied his fleet.

And thats one thing the people on this thread talking about using thousands of ships and etc do not understand. Your ships don't count for squat unless you know tactics

The American Civil War happened, too, but you don't see me slapping Confederate battle flags on all and sundry I come across. And I arguably have a much more direct connection to my controversy-causing affinity than you do to yours.

Also, mine got better book deals

Although I did plan at one point on using the First National Flag as my KSP flag at one point, just to see who would get the reference.

Edited May 22, 2013 by Specialist290

Aye, but Shultz had the disadvantage of only having one laser and was attacking an unknown target. If he had known the Yamato's capabilities he'd have sortied his fleet.

And thats one thing the people on this thread talking about using thousands of ships and etc do not understand. Your ships don't count for squat unless you know tactics

I think his mistake was that when the Yamato was sinking, he didn't continue to hammer upon it until it had broken up. The beam was sufficiently powerful to penetrate into the water and still inflict damage, if anything it would be more damaging that way because of the flooding that would result from multiple hull breaches.

Also, glaring error in underestimating the capabilities of a handful of one man fighters. How many times will that same concept be a plot device...

In terms of what that means for your claim to Laythe, my method would not at all be affected by those differences.

And must we bring up sensitive topics again?

Edited May 22, 2013 by OdinYggd

I don't see how it could be sensitive. History happened, deal with it.

And for the record, it's my own emblem, not one belonging to the Third Reich.

So, that said (again... and I doubt it'll be the last time.), my Laythe defenses are FAR from perfect, but they're more than enough to handle the common rabble that thinks they can just brute their way in

So, um...

Weather nice where everyone is? The area where Chobit and I are has been really humid. Last two nights we've had thunderstorms. It's been interesting to say the least. But at least it's not tornadoes, right?

Nutt, that image is not appropriate to post here. Do not post it again for any reason.

History did indeed happen.

Rules also happened.

The rules here single out materials that could be interpreted as racist or overly offensive as being inappropriate, even if it is meant as a bit of a joke at the expense of historical accuracy.

Edited May 22, 2013 by OdinYggd

Alright then. I think Trekkette has the right idea with switching topics.

Who is everyone's favorite artist on DeviantArt?

Mine has to be JustV23

His paintings are amazing and are a huge source of inspiration.

In the interests of forum peace, I will hereby concede the argument to chobit.

EDIT: I'm a big fan of Genzoman and dead-robot, myself.

Oh wow, I like that bottom one...

I don't spend a lot of time on dA. Mostly it's harassing people I know IRL (... kinda like what I do here). I do follow a few artists, mostly comic-writers that do MLP stories.

Yes, I'm a brony. Deal. Also, pegasister's a dumb term.

I can't really pick a favourite

I'm a big fan of Genzoman

Hyrotrioskjan is also pretty cool.

He makes neat creatures:

And realistic dragons! Seriously he's probably the first dragon artist to understand that vertebrates can't have more than four limbs!

personly mine is adamburn

Edited May 22, 2013 by redwolfy
My favourite DA artist is Abiogenesis. He makes amazing creatures and vehicles

Hyrotrioskjan is also pretty cool.

He makes neat creatures:

And realistic dragons! Seriously he's probably the first dragon artist to understand that vertebrates can't have more than four limbs!

In IRL, there was a four winged gliding dinosaur. But it's back legs were the second pair of wings, so it didn't have more than four limbs.
This is all I got to say about the stuff that's above

I always pick my passwords from Norse myth, because NOBODY can spell most of them

I read lots of Norse Myth and study them. Way better than the mainstream ones.

QUICK!

The object to your left is now your weapon of choice in the upcoming zombie apocalapse.

What is it?
A backpack and a scooter. I'm screwed.

You think you're screwed? I'm stuck with five candles

Edited May 22, 2013 by KasperVld

A bucket full of machine grease.

Yeah this might not go so well.

A student and his laptop.

He is bait as of this moment.

*reads last few pages*

...

*sigh*

My boyfriend.

Actually, I might be able to survive. He's a pretty decent shot. Not as good as I used to be, but eh, nobody's perfect.

Directly to my left?

<.<

>.>

*blush*

Trashy romance novel. I am such a girl... Dead, too...
